subtitle: hi this is sim and Jacobson and welcome
to meaningful Monday's where we answer
your personal questions the question
this week is about gender challenges why
are some people created with the gender
which they feel is wrong for them I
can't imagine how painful it must be to
live life with a certain identity just
because one was born with a certain
biological makeup this has been on my
mind lately because of a friend who has
struggled with this for years first as a
lesbian and now she has made the
decision to have surgery to no longer be
a woman at all I wonder how it does God
can put a person into a body which they
feel as flawed and needs to be altered
surgically what is your perspective on
this gender issues are unbelievably
complex and mysterious we really don't
even understand what sexuality is all
about I come from a perspective that
we're not just here by accident that God
placed us here and each of us born
whether male or female that's how we
were meant to be we all understand that
all kinds of factors and many
circumstances may contribute to how a
person sees and identifies with their
own gender often it's not necessarily
about nature meaning how you're born
often it's about events that happen in
your formative years events that happen
in how your parents treat you and often
these things affect how we see ourselves
whether male or female we also have to
understand especially as the way the
Mystics explain it all of us have
feminine elements and all of us have
masculine elements even though there is
what is called a man and a woman but
it's not complete mutual exclusive
behavior or personality types there are
feminine aspects to tour man and there
are masculine aspects to a woman some
people have more of a balance less of a
balance this is a very different and
they should be embraced so I don't
believe that it's a simple matter for
someone to just go ahead and say I am
definitely not a man or definitely not a
woman even though biologically and every
other way they were born that way
because you made
tampering with something that may not
bring you happiness anyway I happen to
know someone that went through a gender
change and they're not a happier person
they now struggle whether they've made a
mistake because on one part they feel
male another part they feel female it's
not simple anyone that's a healthy
relationship with their own sexuality
knows that you all have as I mentioned
feminine aspects so what does that mean
that you should suddenly become a female
because it was that so sometimes it's a
distortions and I say with all the
sensitivity with the distortions of how
we perceive our own sexuality and
frankly we live in a world where sexual
identity is a mess and heterosexuals
homosexuals and all other names and
titles that exists because sexuality has
become divorced from intimacy has become
divorce very often from purpose it's
about personal pleasure some people feel
proud actually to say I'm in a sexual
relationship without commitment tell me
that healthy intimacy on the other hand
is a profound experience that isn't just
sexual it's 24 7 it's two people who
bond with each other and the healthiest
form so it's not surprising that we have
especially today so much confusion in
this regard so what I would suggest on a
practical level anyone that's facing
this challenge find out what the soul is
like find out what your life's purpose
is like because you may change something
and then discover you're not happier
because you've never found your calling
maybe that's what it comes down to what
is our calling every male every female
on this earth has their calling has
their mission and it's critical to learn
to embrace what that mission is I mean
you're at peace with that then your
gender fits right in because your gender
is part of how you fulfill the purpose
and calling of your life and above all
it's absolutely critical when it comes
to gender challenges to have someone to
speak to that you trust a mentor a
friend because this issue is so bound up
with isolation despair loneliness very
difficult to make decisions under those
circumstances having someone you can
speak to openly can help you make the
right decision and build the courage and
strength to do what is right this has
been meaningful Monday's if you'd like
to submit your own personal question
click on the link below everyone have a
very meaningful week
